title: Schema for schema description object
description: A schema description is a JSON object that encodes the information about a schema, which describes the structure of a table.

columns.description: An array property of column descriptions as described in section 5.6 Columns. These are matched to columns in tables that use the schema by position: the first column description in the array applies to the first column in the table, the second to the second and so on.

foreignKeys.description: An array property of foreign key definitions that define how the values from specified columns within this table link to rows within this table or other tables.

primaryKey.description: A column reference property that holds either a single reference to a column description object or an array of references.

rowTitles.description: A column reference property that holds either a single reference to a column description object or an array of references. The value of this property determines the titles annotation for each row within a table that uses this schema.

@id.description: If included, @id is a link property that identifies the schema described by this schema description. It must not start with _:.

@type.description: If included, @type is an atomic property that must be set to "Schema".
